tasks: Neumann heat flow on nonconvex Riemannian domains
results: Equivalent characterization of the second fundamental form
title: Gradient and Transport Estimates for Heat Flow on Nonconvex Domains.pdf
abstract: For the Neumann heat ﬂow on nonconvex Riemannian domains D ⊂M, we pro- vide sharp gradient estimates and transport estimates with a novel √ t-dependence, for instance, Lip(P D t f) ≤e2S √ t/π+O(t) · Lip(f), and we provide an equivalent characterization of the lower bound S on the second fundamental form of the boundary in terms of these quantitative estimates. 1 Introduction and Statement of Main Result Throughout this paper we assume: • M is a complete n-dimensional Riemannian manifold and D ⊂M is an open set with compact smooth boundary, n := n∂D is its inward normal vector. • (P D t )t>0 is the heat semigroup on D with generator ∆and Neumann boundary conditions, pt(x, y) the Neumann heat kernel. • Wq( . , . ) denotes the q-Kantorovich-Wasserstein distance • s : ∂D →R denotes the largest lower bound for the second fundamental form II∂D(X, Y ) := −⟨∇X n, Y ⟩on ∂D and k : M →R denotes the largest lower bound for the Ricci curvature on M in the sense that II∂D(v, v) ≥s(x) |v|2, Ric(w, w) ≥k(x) |w|2 ∀v, w ∈TxM, v ⊥n∂D. We assume that k is bounded from below on ¯D. Theorem 1.1. For any p ∈(1, ∞), q ∈[1, ∞) and S ∈R+ the following are equivalent: (i) s ≥−S (ii) ∀t ∈R+, µ, ν ∈P( ¯D), Wq(P D t µ, P D t ν) ≤e2S √ t/π+O(t) · Wq(µ, ν) 1
